page.title: 09Sandfields Library
page.content: The local library at Sandfields was built in 1961. It was built by Afan Borough Council. There are four members of staff including a senior librarian. Very soon they will be losing another member of staff because of cutbacks. There are 4037 members. 3157 are adult members and 1150 are junior members. Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturday mornings are the busiest days at the library and between 3:30 and 5:00 are the busiest times. Wednesdays are probably popular because that is the day when new books arrive. The books are bought centrally by West Glamorgan County Council. Other facilities provided by the library include periodicals, newspapers, cassettes and a reference service. Books can be obtained at the library from anywhere in the country.
